alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hughes; Jones; Lyman; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 3:29AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Expect strong and gusty northwest winds today, with gusts exceeding 45 mph for most areas west of the James River. Relative humidity is forecast to be lowest over south central South Dakota, with readings generally between 25 to 35 percent. Given the state of the fuels in combination with the strong winds and relatively low humidity, the Grassland Fire Danger will be a concern throughout the Missouri River valley. On Wednesday, breezy and gusty northwest winds will continue, but will not be as strong as the speeds experienced today. Afternoon humidity will generally range from 40 to 50 percent over central South Dakota, where fire danger will be elevated once again. By late Wednesday afternoon, there could be some areas of light rain or rain mixed with snow working southward across the Missouri River valley, or at the very least across Corson County down to Jones County. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. The outlook for Wednesday afternoon...The grassland fire danger index will reach the high category.
